decks.notes: The deck focuses on creating a powerful army of tokens through sacrificing creatures and generating mana quickly. It aims to assemble a lethal combo involving Prossh, Skyraider of Kher and cards like Purphoros, God of the Forge and Goblin Bombardment to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck includes various mana ramp spells and creature tutors to efficiently get the combo pieces onto the battlefield. It also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to control the opponent's hand and protect the combo. The key strategy is to ramp up mana quickly, generate tokens, and assemble the combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent with a massive amount of damage in a short amount of time.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly and efficiently deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures with evasive abilities, backed up by disruptive spells to control the board. Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow serves as the commander, providing card advantage and additional damage whenever a Ninja enters the battlefield. The deck includes a variety of evasive creatures such as Faeries, Ninjas, and artifacts like Signal Pest and Ornithopter. It also runs a suite of disruption spells like Force of Will, Thoughtseize, and Fatal Push to control the opponent's game plan. By consistently applying pressure and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to win through combat damage and incremental advantage.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures and powerful spells. The combination of Kraum and Tymna allows for card advantage and incremental damage, while the mana base is designed for consistency and flexibility. The deck includes a wide range of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw options to adapt to different situations. By efficiently managing resources and making strategic decisions, this deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent, ultimately overwhelming them with a combination of aggression and disruption.

This deck focuses on using a combination of powerful spells, versatile creatures, and efficient mana rocks to control the game while applying pressure on the opponent. By utilizing the partner commanders Kraum and Tymna, the deck aims to draw cards consistently and maintain a strong board presence. The key strategy involves leveraging a wide range of removal spells, countermagic, and card advantage to disrupt the opponent's game plan and win through a combination of combat damage and burn spells. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the deck's color requirements and provide access to a variety of powerful lands that can generate multiple types of mana.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively build up the commander, Karlov of the Ghost Council, by utilizing a variety of removal spells, protection cards, and life gain options. The goal is to consistently increase Karlov's power and toughness by gaining life through various means such as Soul Warden and Serra Ascendant, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Demonic Tutor. Additionally, the deck includes a selection of equipment to further enhance Karlov's capabilities in combat. By efficiently managing resources and leveraging Karlov's abilities, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a potent combination of aggression and resilience.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly to cast powerful spells and creatures while controlling the board through removal and disruption. Nissa, Vastwood Seer helps to ramp up early game while also providing card advantage. The deck includes various mana ramp spells like Exploration, Green Sun's Zenith, and Utopia Sprawl to accelerate mana production. It also includes a mix of powerful creatures and spells like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, Karn Liberated, and Emrakul, the Promised End for late-game control. The deck also includes utility creatures like Oracle of Mul Daya and Courser of Kruphix to provide card advantage and filter draws. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast opponents through mana advantage and powerful threats.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a mix of removal spells, hand disruption, board wipes, and planeswalkers. The goal is to maintain a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's strategy and resources. With a mix of targeted removal like Swords to Plowshares and Path to Exile, efficient sweepers like Toxic Deluge and Wrath of God, and hand disruption like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, the deck aims to keep the opponent on the back foot. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Gideon Jura provides additional threats and value. The mana base is carefully constructed to ensure consistency and access to all necessary colors of mana.

The deck focuses on utilizing Teferi, Temporal Archmage's ability to generate infinite mana and take multiple extra turns to overwhelm the opponent. It includes a variety of ways to untap lands or artifacts, as well as card draw and counterspells to protect the combo. The key strategy is to assemble the combo pieces quickly while disrupting the opponent's game plan to ensure a smooth execution. With the ability to generate a large amount of mana and take multiple turns in a row, the deck aims to create an overwhelming advantage that the opponent cannot recover from. Overall, the deck aims to control the game until it can assemble the combo and win decisively.
